description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society.
author: George Orwell

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.
author: Harper Lee

description: A story of the wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy Buchanan.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Moby Dick
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel of manners that depicts the British Regency era.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A story about teenage rebellion and angst.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: Jane Eyre
description: A novel that follows the emotions and experiences of its title character.

title: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel that critiques the dangers of state control and scientific advancements.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: The Shining
description: A horror novel about a family isolated in a haunted hotel.
author: Stephen King

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A philosophical novel about a man who remains young while his portrait ages.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and his young son.

title: Dracula
description: A novel about the vampire Count Dracula's attempt to move to England.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: A mystery thriller novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon.
author: Dan Brown

title: The Alchemist
description: A novel about the journey of a shepherd boy named Santiago.

title: The Odyssey
description: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer.
author: Homer

title: Frankenstein
description: A novel about a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature.

title: Catch-22
